title: #HwVncService.v1_0_0.HwVncService

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

SSLEncryptionEnabled.longDescription: If it is enabled, SSL encryption transmission is used. If it is disabled, SSL encryption transmission is not used.

SessionTimeoutMinutes.longDescription: This parameter specifies the maximum interval allowed between two VNC sessions. If the timeout timer expires, the session between the VNC and the server will be disconnected.

PasswordComplexityCheckEnabled.description: Function of setting password complexity check.
PasswordComplexityCheckEnabled.longDescription: If it is enabled, password complexity check will be performed for each new password set by the user.

KeyboardLayout.longDescription: There are three types of keyboard layout: English (en) , Japanese (jp) and German (de).

Password.description: Password used to log in to the server from the VNC.
Password.longDescription: If password complexity check is not enabled, the password must be a string of 1 to 8 characters. If password complexity check is enabled, the 8-digit password must meet password complexity requirements.

PasswordValidityDays.longDescription: Specifies the validity period of a user password.

MaximumNumberOfSessions.description: Specifies the maximum number of VNC sessions allowed at the same time.
MaximumNumberOfSessions.longDescription: Specifies the maximum number of users allowed to connect to the system using the VNC. This parameter has a fixed value of 5.

NumberOfActivatedSessions.description: Specifies the number of activated sessions.
NumberOfActivatedSessions.longDescription: Specifies the number of users connecting to the system using the VNC.

SessionMode.description: Mode used to create a session between the VNC and the server.
SessionMode.longDescription: Two modes are available: Share and Exclusive. The Share mode allows a maximum of five VNC clients to connect to a server at the same time. The Exclusive mode allows only one VNC client to connect to a server at a time.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.longDescription: This object represents the Oem property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

Sessions.description: Contains the members of this collection.

Links.description: Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
Links.longDescription: The Links property, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.

LoginRule.longDescription: This property shall contain the link to user group login rules.

HwVncService.description: This schema defines a computer system and its respective properties.  A computer system represents a machine (physical or virtual) and the local resources such as memory, cpu and other devices that can be accessed from that machine.
HwVncService.longDescription: This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a computing system in the Redfish specification.

enumDescriptions.Shared: The Share mode allows a maximum of five VNC clients to connect to a server at the same time.
enumDescriptions.Private: The Exclusive mode allows only one VNC client to connect to a server at a time.
